Games
Class Room

java.lang.Object
  Games.Room

public class Room
extends java.lang.Object

Class Room - a room in an adventure game. This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. The exits are labelled nord, est, sud, ouest. For each direction, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room, or null if there is no exit in that direction.

Version:
1.0 (mai 2009)
Author:
Charlet Pierre, Kniebihler Nicolas, Provost Kevin

Constructor Detail

Room

public Room(java.lang.String description,
            java.lang.String image)
Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".

Parameters:
description - The room's description.
Method Detail

getAllRoom

public static Room getAllRoom(java.lang.String direction)
Get the room that corresponds to the name in parameter in the list of all the rooms : allRoom.

getExit

public Room getExit(java.lang.String direction)
Return the room that is reached if we go from this room in direction "direction". If there is no room in that direction, return null.

Returns:
The room that corresponds with the direction given in parameter.

getImageName

public java.lang.String getImageName()
Return a string describing the room's image name

getItems

public ItemList<java.lang.String,Item> getItems()
Returns:
The list of all the items in the room.

getLongDescription

public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
Return a long description of this room, of the form: You are in the kitchen. Exits: north west

Returns:
A description of the room, including exits.

getShortDescription

public java.lang.String getShortDescription()
Return the description of the room (the one that was defined in the constructor).

Returns:
The description of the room.

Parameters:

neighbor - The room in the given direction.
